page.title: 18Southam's Places of Interest
page.content: Two of Southam's most interesting buildings have connections with the {Civil War.}These are the{Old Mint}and the{Chemist's Shop.}The Old Mint is now a public house and many visitors are attracted to it because of its antiquated appearance. It gets its name from the fact that coins were once minted there. Local tradition suggests that Charles I had silver cast into coins there after the{Battle {of Edgehill. The Chemist's Shop used to be a Manor House where Charles I once slept. It is an attractive half-timbered house with an overhanging upper storey. Outside the town is{Stoneythorpe Hall which has belonged to the same family for over 300 years. In 1625 it was rebuilt after a fire. The present house has 18 rooms. Dutch elm disease has destroyed the tree lined driveway.
